remarks: A multiple of a point of finite order only has the same order if the multiplier is relatively prime.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2015.)
statement:
odmulgid.1 $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
odmulgid.2 $e |- O = ( od ` G ) $.
odmulgid.3 $e |- .x. = ( .g ` G ) $.
odmulgeq $p |- ( ( ( G e. Grp /\ A e. X /\ N e. ZZ ) /\ ( O ` A ) e. NN ) -> ( ( O ` ( N .x. A ) ) = ( O ` A ) <-> ( N gcd ( O ` A ) ) = 1 ) ) $.
